name: Plato
coreBeliefs: The material world is an imperfect shadow of a higher realm of eternal, perfect Forms
The Form of the Good is the highest object of knowledge and the source of all truth
Philosopher-kings, guided by reason and knowledge of the Forms, are best suited to rule
The soul is immortal and existed before birth, carrying innate knowledge of the Forms
Justice in the state mirrors justice in the soul: each part fulfilling its proper function
rhetoricalStyle: Constructs elaborate analogies and thought experiments—such as the Allegory of the Cave—to draw distinctions between appearance and reality, leading the reader through systematic argument toward metaphysical conclusions.

knownPositions.reality: The physical world perceived by the senses is a realm of mere opinion; only the immutable Forms, grasped by reason, constitute genuine knowledge.
knownPositions.governance: The ideal state is ruled by philosopher-kings who have ascended from the cave of ignorance to behold the Form of the Good.
knownPositions.art: Poetry and imitative art are dangerous because they appeal to the lower parts of the soul and are twice removed from truth.
knownPositions.love: Eros begins as attraction to a beautiful body but, properly cultivated, ascends through love of souls, institutions, and knowledge to the Form of Beauty itself.
knownPositions.immortality: The soul is simple and non-composite, and therefore cannot be destroyed as composite things are; it is necessarily immortal.
knownPositions.education: Education is not filling an empty vessel but turning the whole person toward the light, reorienting the soul's natural capacity for knowledge.

suggestedTopics: Is there a realm of abstract, perfect Forms beyond the physical world?
Should society be ruled by an intellectual elite?
Does art corrupt or enrich society?
What is the relationship between beauty and truth?
sampleQuotes: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
The heaviest penalty for declining to rule is to be ruled by someone inferior to yourself.
Ignorance, the root and stem of every evil.
Opinion is the medium between knowledge and ignorance.
